basics.name: Kaaustaaub Shankar
basics.label: Computer Science Student
basics.summary: Highly motivated Computer Science student with experience in full-stack web development, AI research, and team leadership, seeking opportunities to apply technical skills and drive innovation.

work.name: Venture Research Studio
work.summary: Building an AI agent to automate market research, identifying comparables, patents, and niches resulting in 3x improvement.
highlights: Using Serper.dev, LangChain, Gemini, and OpenAI to create web scraping agents, delivering real-time market insights

work.name: Bearcat Ventures
work.summary: Managing a $1M Evergreen fund and invested in 3 pre-seed and seed startups.

work.name: Motz Engineering
work.summary: Leading the development of a full-stack web application for MEP professionals using Figma, React.js, Flask, and MySQL.
highlights: Collaborating with upper management to understand industry needs and ensure the application's alignment with requirements.
Transitioning databases to cloud infrastructure to improve scalability and performance.
Developing a C# WinForms application with advanced functionalities, including AI integration, to enhance user experience and workflow efficiency.
Created a Billing Forecast pipeline that leverage industry knowledge to improve forecasting accuracy, achieving a projected error reduction of approximately 15%.

work.name: University of Cincinnati
work.position: Student Researcher under Dr. Kelly Cohen’s AI Bio Lab
work.summary: Conducted research funded by John Deere for Spatial-Temporal Decision Making in Unreal Engine using Genetic Fuzzy Systems.
highlights: Created PyGame & Genetic Fuzzy System for AI training with Backtracking.
Presented industry driven research findings to top-level management at companies, including Kinetic Vision, Proctor & Gamble, and Siemens.
Organized North American Fuzzy Information Processing Society (NAFIPS) conferences with 60 attendees, ensuring a seamless experience.
Currently working on Fuzzy- Random Rapidly Evolving Trees algorithm for Robotic Survey with results showing an improvement of 743% in search time.
Paper linked at https://arxiv.org/abs/2504.17979.

work.name: University of Cincinnati Foundation
work.summary: Achieved $22,932.76 in contributions to the University of Cincinnati Foundation through securing 93 commitments via pledges and credit card gifts.
highlights: Directly managed shifts involving 20+ associates to ensure daily operations ran smoothly and goals were met.
Provided mentorship and assistance to associates through coaching to contribute team success.

education.highlights: Activities and Societies: Innovation Challenge, Bearcat Ventures Deal Flow, Tamil Student Association

projects.name: WhiteBox
projects.summary: Conceptualized WhiteBox, a tool enhancing LLM credibility via Hybrid RAG, and led the team to first place.
highlights: Fine-tuned Llama-3.1-uncensored to extract and visualize entity relationships from medical textbooks.
Developing a custom Hybrid RAG pipeline using Langchain, Neo4j, and Cypher queries to integrate structured data with LLM outputs.
Collaborating with academics, industry leaders, and Google engineers to improve the tool’s performance and utility.

projects.name: Memento
projects.summary: Co-led a team to third place at RevolutionUC 2024 with the app Memento for Alzheimer's patients and doctors.
highlights: Won four awards, including 'Third Place', Best Social Impact Hack, Best Digital Solution to Improve the Clinical Trial Process (Medpace), and Best Use of Postgres (Tembo).
Integrated Tembo's AI Stack with custom LLM technology to create an assistant for patients and provide treatment data to doctors/clinicians.

projects.name: Buycott
projects.summary: Co-led a team to first place at MakeUC 2023 to design Buycott, an app focused on empowering users to voice opinions on issues such as the Israel-Palestine Conflict.
highlights: Garnered four accolades, including 'Best Hack', 'Best Social Issues Hack,' 'Best Use of Google Cloud,' and a 'Wolfram Research Award".
Developed a feature-rich app using Flutter, supporting barcode scanning, data processing, and sentiment analysis through Google Cloud within a 25-hour sprint.

projects.name: Visualizing the Movements of Kuka 7 Node Robot Arm
projects.summary: Co-led a team to first place in Kinetic Vision's hackathon challenge to visualize the movement of a Kuka 7 Robot Arm.
highlights: Developed a Unity, C#, and Python-based visualization allowing users to control a robot arm directly or utilize dataset-driven commands, managing a dataset with over 18k entries.
